ResourceHeader.Description:
Housekeeping RAW data from RADEM (JUICE)
      
RADEM data is stored in two .cdf file types with corresponding labels (.lbx): sc - science and hk - housekeeping


The hk files have operational information including the RADEM's operation mode. Science data is only acquired when RADEM_MODE 
is in Normal mode. However, flight calibrations are also made in this Normal mode - refer to the caveats section for more information.


The sc files contain the measurements made by the detectors integrated in time (default is 60s - check INTEGRATION_TIME 
variable in the files). In the data_raw, detector observations are split into eight ELECTRONS bins (EDH), eight PROTONS bins 
(PDH), two HEAVY_IONS bins (HIDH), 31 directionality detector bins (DDH), and 12 CUSTOM bins (mix of EDH and PDH - check the EAICD). The sensitivity of each bin 
depends on the configuration (see the EAICD for more information).


* Configuration 1

In this configuration all detectors work in single coincidence. The main objective was to maximize its sensitivity to cosmic rays to test all sensors. This means that all 
detectors are measuring electrons, protons and heavy ions at the same time. However, they are more sensitive to protons and to heavy ions than to electrons. Moreover, proton 
fluxes are typically much higher than that of heavy ions so the response to protons should dominate even with large contamination from electrons and heavy ions.


* Configuration 2

The PDH was changed to multiple coincidence. 

The CUSTOM channels are now being used. 

The thresholds of all detectors with the exception of the second HIDH were changed significantly. 

PROTONS variable are well separated in energy (see EAICD) with almost no contamination from either electrons or heavy ions.

ELECTRONS variable measure electrons above a certain energy (see EAICD or metadata). The first bin is contaminated by low energy protons (~7.8 MeV). All bins are contaminated by 
high energy protons (>~ 45-70 MeV).

Directionality detector bins measure electrons above 0.3 MeV (0º, and 22.5º zenith sensors), 0.35 MeV (45º zenith sensors), and 0.5 MeV (67.5º sensors). All bins are contaminated by high energy 
protons (>~ 40-50 MeV).

HEAVY_IONS bin 2 measures ions with energies between 30.9-90 MeV/nucleon and above 100 MeV/nucleon.

CUSTOM channels measure a variety of particles and energies (check EAICD)

InformationURL.Name: PSA/ESA server
InformationURL.Description: All RADEM data is publicly available in the PSA/ESA server.

InformationURL.Name: RADEM EAICD
InformationURL.Description: JUICE RADEM Experiment to Archive Interface Control Document (RADEM EAICD)

NumericalData.Caveats:
14.04.2023 - 30.04.2023: NECP - Non scientific data.

30.08.2023 - Onwards:    A few directional sensors are fully masked/shadowed by the spacecraft (directionality detector Bins 8, 9, 16-19, 25-28).

30.08.2023 - Onwards:    The first Heavy ion detector diode is unresponsive since launch.

30.08.2023 - 30.08.2023: RADEM Configuration 1: detectors in single coincidence.

30.04.2024 - 30.04.2024: Software test - do not use data.

21.05.2024 - 28.05.2024: Threshold scan (flight calibration) - do not use data.

09.07.2024 - 09.07.2024: RADEM Configuration 2. Large reconfiguration of the coincidence logic and its thresholds.

04.08.2024 - 04.08.2024: Third re-configuration. Small reconfiguration of Proton Bin 3.

Parameter.Name: mode
Parameter.Description: RADEM working mode (10 - Calibration, 5 - Safe and 15 - Normal)

Parameter.Name: system errors
Parameter.Description:
System Errors: CEU Software Status and Parametric Errors
LRG30728 - Breakdown:
* Bit 0 (LSB): Found SRAM correctable error
* Bit 1: Found MRAM correctable error
* Bit 2: Found SRAM uncorrectable error
* Bit 3: Found MRAM uncorrectable error
* Bit 4: EDH access error
* Bit 5: PIDH access error

LRG30753 - Breakdown:
* Bit 0 (LSB): PCU OR CEU Temperatures
* Bit 1: PIDH Temperature
* Bit 2: EDH Temperature
* Bit 3: DDH Temperature
* Bit 4: PIDH Vbias/Mbias
* Bit 5: EDH Vbias/Mbias
* Bit 6: DDH Vbias/Mbias
* Bit 7: HK 4V3 Soft Limit
* Bit 8: PIDH 1V8
* Bit 9: EDH 1V8
* Bit 10: DDH 1V8
* Bit 11: PIDH 3V3
* Bit 12: EDH 3V3
* Bit 13: DDH 3V3
* Bit 14: Mbias/Vbias
* Bit 15: VREF CEU 3V3
* Bit 29: Vbias Hard Limit
* Bit 30: HK 4V3 Hard Limit
* Others: DC

Parameter.Name: BIST status
Parameter.Description: BIST Status procedure, responsible to perform the RADEM self-test, where RADEM Detector Heads and Power Supply Health are evaluated.

Parameter.Name: detector heads status
Parameter.Description:
PIDH Detector Status, EDH Detector Status, DDH Detector Status (ON/OFF), PIDH ASIC Status, EDH ASIC Status, DDH ASIC Status (SEL detected and internal Errors).

LRT30707 - Bit 0 (LSB): PIDH Detector ON/OFF
LRT30715 - Bit 0 (LSB): EDH Detector ON/OFF
LRT30723 - Bit 0 (LSB): DDH Detector ON/OFF
LRT30706 - Bit 0 (LSB): PIDH ASIC Scrubbing Error
LRT30714 - Bit 0 (LSB): EDH ASIC Scrubbing Error
LRT30722 - Bit 0 (LSB): DDH ASIC Scrubbing Error

Parameter.Name: voltages
Parameter.Description: System voltages. Parameters under control are PCU +92.5V and +4.3V, Detector 90V, CEU 3.3V and the ASICs suply voltage of 3.3V and 1.8V.

Parameter.Name: currents
Parameter.Description: PIDH, EDH, and DDH ASICs Mbias (reference current).

Parameter.Name: temperatures
Parameter.Description: System Temperatures: PCU, CEU, PIDH, EDH, DDH.

Parameter.Name: CEU mem. err. counters
Parameter.Description: System Memory Error Counters: SRAM Single Error, SRAM Double Error, MRAM Double Error and MRAM Double Error.

Parameter.Name: ASIC err. counters
Parameter.Description: PIDH, EDH, and DDH ASIC Error Counters.

Parameter.Name: ASIC latchup monitor
Parameter.Description: ASIC Latchup Monitor: PIDH, EDH, DDH.

Parameter.Name: ASIC scrubbing
Parameter.Description: ASIC Scrubbing: PIDH, EDH, DDH Bit 0 error status.

Parameter.Name: ASIC tables
Parameter.Description: ASIC configuration in use including coincidence logic (Coincidence Tables) and thresholds (Register Table).
